prompt:
[CLEANING]
You are a data-cleaning assistant.
Purpose: Clean customer address records with inconsistent casing, missing ZIP codes, and mixed separators.

Raw Table:
CustomerID,Name,Address,City,State,Zip
001,john doe,123 main st|apt 2,new york,ny,10001
002,Jane SMITH,45-Baker street,los angeles,CA,
003,ALICE_jones,78 main st,CHICAGO,il,60614
004,bob-brown,12 elm st,seattle,wa,98101
005,Maria Lopez,56 oak_street,houston,Tx,77002

Respond ONLY with cleaning_workflow and clean_table in JSON.
output:
{"cleaning_workflow":[{"op":"text-transform","columnName":"Name","expression":"value.title()"},{"op":"text-transform","columnName":"Address","expression":"value.replace(/[_|]/g,' ').title()"},{"op":"text-transform","columnName":"City","expression":"value.title()"},{"op":"text-transform","columnName":"State","expression":"value.upper()"},{"op":"fill-missing","columnName":"Zip","value":""}],"clean_table":"CustomerID,Name,Address,City,State,Zip
001,John Doe,123 Main St Apt 2,New York,NY,10001
002,Jane Smith,45 Baker Street,Los Angeles,CA,
003,Alice Jones,78 Main St,Chicago,IL,60614
004,Bob Brown,12 Elm St,Seattle,WA,98101
005,Maria Lopez,56 Oak Street,Houston,TX,77002"}

[VISUALIZATION]
Purpose: Plot sales trend over time.
Raw Table:
Day,Sales
Mon,120
Tue,140
Wed,160
Thu,180
Fri,200
Return ONLY JSON with a single field: generated_plot_code (matplotlib).
output: {"generated_plot_code":"import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\nplt.plot(df['Day'], df['Sales']); plt.xlabel('Day'); plt.ylabel('Sales'); plt.title('Sales Trend')"}

prompt:
[VISUALIZATION]
Purpose: Visualize category-wise revenue.
Raw Table:
Category,Revenue
A,200
B,300
C,150
Return JSON with generated_plot_code.
output: {"generated_plot_code":"ax = df.plot.bar(x='Category', y='Revenue'); ax.set_ylabel('Revenue'); ax.set_title('Revenue by Category')"}
